dataObject.content: After dozens of mass shootings in recent years, however, including at schools like the February 2018 massacre in Parkland, Florida, that left 17 dead, curbing gun violence has become a component of the Democratic policy platform embraced by congressional and presidential candidates.

annotationData.content: {"category":{"label":"Biased"},"rationale":"an expelled student entered Parkland, Florida's Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School and opened fire, killing 17 people and wounding 17"}
{"category":{"label":"Biased"},"rationale":"Biased. It links the news to the Democratic candidates, influencing an opinion on these specific candidates."}
